summary: Quagga and zebra mussels are invasive species in the U.S. that threaten ecosystems and infrastructure. They can spread by clinging to watercraft that have been in infested waters. This Q&A report looks at how the Army Corps of Engineers partners with certain states to help fund inspection and decontamination stations to remove invasive species. Corps and state officials told us that these stations help to...
title: Army Corps of Engineers: Better Data and Planning Needed to Combat Aquatic Invasive Species
